page.title: 11TRANSPORT CLAXBY/USSELBY
page.content: There are not any scheduled public transport services for the area, although buses connecting nearby towns pass through on the A46. The population thus relies heavily on cars, bicycles and taxis to get about. The children attending schools in Market Rasen and Holton-le-Moor are collected by a school bus each morning and brought home at night. The nearest British Rail station is at Market Rasen and it is possible to catch a direct train from here to and from London once a day, also regular services to other parts of the country. Because of the transport problems most people do try to help neighbours, particularly during the bad weather, and a good community spirit prevails as a result.
